TITLE: Cartier owner Richemont sales rise 10% in December quarter despite ongoing China weakness
SUMMARY: Cartier owner Richemont on Thursday reported a 10% increase in third quarter sales even as China demand weighed.

TITLE: Shares of Cartier owner Richemont jump 16% as sales rise in December quarter
SUMMARY: Cartier owner Richemont on Thursday reported a 10% increase in third quarter sales even as China demand weighed.

TITLE: Burberry shares jump 13% after better-than-expected quarterly sales
SUMMARY: Burberry on Friday reported a shallower-than-expected dip in sales in the fiscal third quarter, in the first glimpse of fresh efforts to revamp the beleaguered British fashion house.

TITLE: Mystery around top-ranked Rockefeller book grows as university publisher denies involvement
SUMMARY: The book is ranked No. 22 on Amazon's list of best-selling economic history books, yet it's filled with factual errors.

TITLE: World's largest luxury group LVMH posts better than feared full-year sales
SUMMARY: The world's largest luxury company LVMH on Tuesday reported better-than-expected full-year sales, in the strongest sign yet of a potential turnaround in the high-end sector.

TITLE: Shares of LVMH drop 5% as full-year results throw doubt on broad luxury recovery
SUMMARY: LVMH shares dropped as slightly better-than-expected full-year results from the world's largest luxury company threw doubt over a broader sector recovery.

TITLE: LVMH watch and jewelry CEOs see luxury sales picking up in 2025
SUMMARY: The CEOs of Tiffany & Co., TAG Heuer and Bulgari and the director of watches for Louis Vuitton weigh in on China sales, tariffs and luxury best-sellers.

TITLE: Kering slightly beats fourth-quarter forecasts even as sales at embattled Gucci brand plunge 24%
SUMMARY: French luxury goods firm Kering reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter sales that were still down year-on-year amid lagging demand for the Gucci label.

TITLE: Birkin bag maker Hermes posts better-than-expected jump in fourth-quarter sales
SUMMARY: Haute couture fashion house Hermes on Friday reported a better-than-expected jump in fourth quarter sales.

TITLE: Europe's luxury sector is showing signs of revival — but China weakness and tariff threats loom
SUMMARY: The sector had an upbeat earnings season. But continued weakness in China and U.S. tariffs could leave even the most exclusive brands vying for share of pocket.

TITLE: Trump’s proposed 'gold card' visa comes with a hidden tax break for the wealthy
SUMMARY: President Donald Trump's proposed $5 million "gold card" for U.S. residency would be one the most expensive in the world, according to experts.

TITLE: Kering shares plunge 11% after Demna Gvasalia named as Gucci's artistic director
SUMMARY: Shares of Kering plunged on Friday after the firm announced that Demna Gvasalia would take the reigns as new artistic director of its ailing Gucci fashion line.

TITLE: Tariff fears are raising construction costs by up to 20%, says Related Group CEO
SUMMARY: Related said the high end of the real estate market remains strong, especially in Florida.

TITLE: Ferrari says it will raise prices by 10% on some models to offset auto tariffs
SUMMARY: Ferrari produces all of its cars at its Maranello factory. Last year, the company produced 13,752 cars.

TITLE: Manhattan's luxury real estate market sees best first quarter in six years
SUMMARY: Manhattan apartment sales rose 29% in the first quarter, and the total value of apartment sales in the city reached $5.7 billion, up 56%.

TITLE: Luxury firms face tariff hit as recession fears mount
SUMMARY: Europe's beloved luxury brands may be largely sheltered from the initial effects of sweeping U.S. tariffs, but the risks of a wider economic downturn spell bad news for the sector.

TITLE: LVMH dethroned by Hermès as world's most valuable luxury stock after sales miss
SUMMARY: Sales were "overall below the most conservative buyside expectations," Citi analysts said, with wines and spirits suffering the sharpest decline.
